p: There is one synonym: Myrica kandtiana Engl. M. kandtiana is an herb, shrub, or short multibranched tree that spreads. The flowers are on the inflorescences, which are greenish yellow. The inflorescences occur on the older rather than on the younger branches. It grows in grasslands, in seasonal swamps, or swampy areas, but is very rare nowadays [ 41, 42]. Local names in different languages in Uganda are as follows: Luganda: mukikimbo, bowolola omusajja, and enkikimbo [ 14, 41, 43] and Runyankore/Runyoro: omujeje [ 41].
